artists.name: The Beatles
artists.description: Redefined pop with constant reinvention, from Merseybeat to psychedelia.

artists.name: The Rolling Stones
artists.description: Blues-driven swagger that set the tone for rock excess and grit.

artists.name: The Kinks
artists.description: Masters of sharp riffs and observational songwriting rooted in English life.

artists.name: Small Faces
artists.description: Mod icons blending R&B energy with soulful, psychedelic twists.

artists.name: The Zombies
artists.description: Baroque pop perfectionists, best known for lush harmonies and inventive arrangements.

artists.name: The Who
artists.description: Explosive rock operatics and teenage rebellion distilled into anthems.

artists.name: Pink Floyd
artists.description: Psychedelic explorers who evolved into progressive rock’s visionaries.

artists.name: Nick Drake
artists.description: Gentle, haunting folk voice with timeless intimacy.

artists.name: The Velvet Underground
artists.description: Dark, experimental, and influential well beyond their short lifespan.

artists.name: Captain Beefheart
artists.description: Avant-blues visionary pushing rock into chaotic, surreal territory.

artists.name: 13th Floor Elevators
artists.description: Psychedelic pioneers with raw garage energy and electric jug weirdness.

artists.name: Silver Apples
artists.description: Proto-electronic duo bending oscillators into futuristic soundscapes.

artists.name: Buddy Holly
artists.description: Rock’n’roll’s early innovator with clean songwriting and lasting influence.

artists.name: Roy Orbison
artists.description: Operatic ballads and soaring vocals that stood apart from the rock norm.

artists.name: Otis Redding
artists.description: Soul powerhouse whose emotive voice became timeless.

artists.name: James Brown
artists.description: The Godfather of Soul, laying the blueprint for funk and modern R&B.

artists.name: Shuggie Otis
artists.description: Young prodigy fusing soul, funk, and psychedelic textures.

artists.name: The Beach Boys
artists.description: California dreamers who elevated surf pop into lush studio masterpieces.

artists.name: Sly and the Family Stone
artists.description: Multiracial funk-soul innovators with anthems of unity and groove.

artists.name: Chuck Berry
artists.description: Guitar hero and storyteller, foundational to rock’s DNA.

artists.name: Keith Mansfield
artists.description: Composer whose swinging, cinematic library music defined 60s cool.

artists.name: Marvin Gaye
artists.description: From Motown crooner to socially conscious soul poet.

artists.name: Aretha Franklin
artists.description: The Queen of Soul, commanding and gospel-powered.

artists.name: The Ronettes
artists.description: Girl-group icons immortalized by Phil Spector’s wall of sound.

artists.name: Nico
artists.description: German chanteuse whose icy delivery defined The Velvet Underground’s art edge.

artists.name: Cher
artists.description: Pop icon bridging folk-pop beginnings with bold solo stardom.
